intro: Procris approximata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. However, it contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
